message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.RO, cs.LG

The paper deals with markerless motion capture algorithms, which are commonly used in computer vision and graphics. The proposed method involves creating a rigged actor model with skeleton, volumetric shape, appearance, and optionally a body surface, and estimating the actor's motion from multi-view video input only. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves optimization and statistical modeling, which are relevant to the Robotics (cs.RO) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Finally, the paper also involves image processing and analysis, which is relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CV and cs.GR, followed by cs.MM, cs.RO, and cs.LG.
